fields.description:
While I can accept this has likely been requested in the past already, and possibly multiple times, I am worried that the responses from purists maybe blocking the development of this feature. I've listened to their arguments. However, based on years of experience, I submit that the inability to have multiple backlogs for a single project is stifling progress.

Once created, the purists can select one backlog anyway.. either way they will be happy. But for the many of us who move in and out of the box, we're limited in our planning and deployment. Time is wasted when a backlog simply becomes too large, and takes too long to sift through for Sprint planning, and in the end, we end up using an external tool anyway. So, either way, we are going to use multiple backlogs, and it would be preferable to have them all in the one location.
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple backlogs in a single project

fields.description:
Per my discussion with @philip, we are going to start using Drip for automated campaigns to people who primarily use the tool but also to people who we have in our database that we are trying to convert to become paying financial customers.

Here are the tasks at hand for the dev team:

1) Integrate Zoomer & Drip --> make sure any info submitted in zoomer including every form answer turns into a subscriber in Drip. The answers to their questions should be made into user attributes. 

2) Place Drip Pixel (log in for Drip account sent to Philip) --> This pixel should be placed on every single page including every web flow page and every zoomer page. THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT! I will submit a ticket to Drip to see what advice they have for webflow. 

3) Create user events --> Each subscriber should trigger an event for 1) Starting the form and 2) Submitting the form at a minimum. But I also want to know how many other pages they have viewed so that should be an attribute/event as well. Basically anything we consider an event in Mixpanel should also be one in drip. 

4) Create User Attribute for custom tool URL --> I need to be able to include the subscriber's unique link to the plan they made with the tool in a lot of these email so please make sure that custom attribute is included. 

Let me know if I can provide any guidance or clarification! 

Drip Help Docs: https://www.drip.co/docs
fields.summary: Integrate Drip with Truelink Database and Webpages

h3. Summary
Can't select "+ Create issue" if it's open on a different Epic

Cloud - JIRA v1000.526.2

fields.description:
As a JIRA Administrator, I would like to be able to disable the new capability of project admins to modify a project's workflow (introduced in JIRA Software 7.3) so that I can ensure the integrity of already existing:
 * filters
 * gadgets
 * dashboards
 * reports
 * Confluence pages that get info from JIRA

as many of them can (and will) be broken when they were built with the previous workflow statuses in mind.

Therefore, this capability needs to be controllable at different levels:
 # *Instance* (ON - OFF)
 # *Global permission*: control group(s) of users eligible to have this capability in projects.
 # *Project permissions*: ** new permission to be added to the permission scheme.

Note that level 2 seems to be redundant due to the existence of level 3, but it isn't really:

It should be possible to grant the new permission to a project role, and, simultaneously, not effectively granting the permission to a user that doesn't belong to the group of people set on level 2.

That's specially relevant when you don't want some project admins to be able to have this ability, but they could add themselves to the project role which grants this ability.

Also note that adding a group to the permission scheme instead wouldn't solve the problem.

So, for a user to be able to have this ability, all 3 levels should be true.
fields.summary: Way to disable the modification of a workflow by project admins

fields.description:
We just completed a sprint and all the incomplete issues are supposed to be carried over to the next sprint, however we found that 6 of these issues ended up in the backlog.  When we tried to move them manually to the new sprint, they would immediately be moved back to the backlog again.  We've tried dragging it to the sprint in the backlog, and manually editing the sprint field on the issue, however each time it will appear to have been added successfully, but once the page is refreshed it's back in the backlog again.  

Looking at the history of the issue shows that the Sprint field has indeed been updated, but then it immediately reverts back to a blank value (see attached screenshot for example).

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, any issues that is resolved in future sprint or backlog, will be removed from the board. This is because the resolved issues are considered as those which do not need to be worked on. However, there are cases where it was resolved by mistake. As JIRA Agile board removes it right away, the users often do not even noticed. This lead to having some issues missing off track. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have built-in filter (perhaps at the left side panel of the board) to show the issues that get resolved outside active sprint (future sprint or backlog) that user or scrum master can refer to, to see if there is any issues resolved by mistake. Scrum master can reopen the case if the issues need to worked on.
fields.summary: Having a built-in filter for issues resolved outside active sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Starting in JIRA 7.2.0, the issue detail view in boards became editable, per [JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes].

When story points are being edited in this issue detail view, a info bubble with the text "Story Points" appears, which ends up appearing right on top of where the confirm check button is. While the bubble is present, you cannot click on the confirm check button (also where it overlaps with the cancel check button, the same thing will happen there). Moving the mouse will cause this to rapidly flash in and out of the screen, interfering with the user's ability to click either of these boxes.

Better visualized:
 [^Story_Points.mp4] 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.0 - JIRA 7.2.3
Firefox 49.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Ensure that Story Points are visible in the screens for the project(s) the board is configured with to ensure that the field will be editable
2. Click the Estimate to try to edit the value inside
3. Note the Story Points bubble popping up

h3. Expected Results

The bubble should not be showing when trying to click the button. The other fields that are editable on this screen all show a different bubble, "Press Alt+s to submit this form", and the bubble doesn't overlap with the buttons.

h3. Actual Results

The bubble pops up, interfering with the buttons.
 
h3. Notes

The severity of this behavior appears to be environment specific. I found that my success rate for clicking the button and avoiding the bubble was very high, but other environments may find that the bubble persists longer, appears more frequency, etc..

h3.Workaround

Confirm your edit using the Enter key on your keyboard instead of clicking the button.
fields.summary: Story Points info bubble on JIRA Software Server interferes with confirmation check button in board's issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The following applies to issue types other than Epics:
* I do not have easy click-and drag linking for issue types other than Epics.
* I do not have a comprehensive count/overview within the Epics Panel of Boards for issue types other than Epics (Issues, Completed, “Status Bar” of completion).
* I do not have an EASY way to create “quick filters” based on the selection of a specific item (key). (It is not practical to create a ‘Quick Filter’ for every given key).
* I do not have a quick and consistent (user friendly) means of creating issues within another issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
The features offered by the Epics Panel allow for a solution to all 4 bullets above (SEE BELOW). Allowing for the selection of issue types when selecting ‘Epics panel’ from the Column management of Board Configurations will satisfy all three problems, while maximizing already developed JIRA functionality in an easy manner.  !image002.jpg.png|thumbnail!
I do not have easy click-and drag linking f !image001.png.png|thumbnail! or issue types other than Epics.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-15399].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Within JIRA, the current Development Panel will only list the number of Crucible reviews related to that issue in a single state (Open or Closed, etc).   However this will not give you the total number of reviews related to that issue directly on the page itself.  For example

1. 2 open reviews -> OK
 2. 2 closed reviews - > OK
 3. 1 open review and 1 closed review -> Only lists the 1 open review

Granted when you click on that link the popup window will show you all the review and their states correctly.  The problem is that the the development panel within JIRA is limiting what information it provides here.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if you could see the total number of reviews, and all the states/status of them without having to click on the review link.
h3. Why this is important

A related bug, -JSW-13607-, touched on this behavior, but was ultimately closed as 'cannot reproduce'.   However from reading a comment from Matthew Watson, it makes it seem like this particular aspect (the total issues listed in the panel) is by design:
{quote}Also note that the count on the development panel is not the total count, it is only the count of reviews/pull-requests/builds that are in a given state (open/merged/failing/ etc.)
{quote}
Quoted comment from -JSW-13607-

 

!developmentpanel1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Development panel for Crucible review should show total

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, issues that are not estimated can be added to sprints regardless. When these are added and users change the estimation during sprints, scope gets changed and it also affects charts that are generated for each sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Restrict issues being added to sprint if they are not estimated.

h3. Why this is important
It would ensure that scope changes are minimal and agile reports would reflect the sprint better.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Restrict issues from being added to sprint if unestimated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The custom field of type Select List (multiple choices) requires the customer to add options available to chose. The customer would want this filed to be auto populated. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to auto populate a custom field based on a condition
fields.summary: Auto populate custom field values based on condition

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
From the Agile board there's no way to immediately tell if an issue has linked issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
We propose that you provide a way to color these cards to signify that they are linked to another issue.

h3. Why this is important
You can find any related issues at quick glance rather than having to open each card.
fields.summary: Card colors based on linked issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Sprint Health Gadget doesn't show the correct number of flagged issues 

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Sprint 
# Add Flag to some issues 
# Configure the dashboard Sprint Health Gadget to show the Board where this Sprint is Active

h3. Expected Results
Show the correct number of flagged issues in the Sprint

h3. Actual Results
Wrong number of flagged issues is shown


h3.Workaround
no workaround available
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget shows wrong number of flagged issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 6, clicking on a Fix Version of an issue will lead users to an overview of that version (Releases page). 
!6.png|thumbnail!

However, in JIRA 7, clicking on a Fix Version will lead users to the Issue Navigator, automatically searching for all issues with that same fix version
!7.png|thumbnail!

This is intended behaviour as explained in [JRA-44916|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44916]. However, some users actually want to see the overview of the version instead since there is always the option to *View in Issue Navigator*

h3. Suggestion
Give an option to the admin/users to either redirect to the Releases page or the Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Fix Versions on the View Issue page redirect to an issue navigator search

fields.description: Make it possible to use a swimlane in a kanban board to change or update a field in an issue? For instance I could configure a board so that it has swimlanes based on priority, or assignee, or team so that if I dragged the issue from one swimlane to another it would create, update, change or delete a value or attribute in an issue field?
fields.summary: Change field property based on swimlane

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint Health Gadget auto-generated incorrect query
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sprint
 # Add two different components on the project (at this example we'll be using: "Team Enigma" and "Team Green Bay Packers")
 # Go to the board of the project and create a new filter using the following JQL: project = YOUR PROJECT AND component = "Team Enigma" ORDER BY component ASC, Rank ASC
 # After changing the board filter, we'll only see issues with Componenet/s = "Team Enigma"
 # Go back to JIRA main page and add the gadget "Sprint Health Gadget"
 # Click in the "In progress" issues and then click on "View issue in Navigator"
 # At the issue navigator, instead of using the JQL setup at step #3 (project = YOUR PROJECT AND component = "Team Enigma" ORDER BY component ASC, Rank ASC) the JQL is being replaced by: status in ("In Progress") AND Sprint = 52
 Showing some issues that are not supposed to be shown here like issues with component = "Team Green Bay Packers"

h3. Expected Results

Show only issues that has component = "Team Enigma"
h3. Actual Results

We're getting results from both components ("Team Enigma" and "Team Green Bay Packers")
  
h3. Notes

Attached a sample video to demonstrate the issue

[^Sprint.mp4]
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget auto-generated incorrect query

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We used to be able to right click on an issue from a board and open the issue in a new browser window or tab. Now we have to click on the issue to open it in the right hand pane and then click again to open it. Can this old functionality be added to the new UI? The right hand pane is not especially user friendly and we much prefer having several issues open at once.
fields.summary: Right click to open issues in a new window/tab

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We would like to able to sort and filter releases in the release page by most of the columns present there (version, start date, release date). As an MVP, sorting by release date would go a long way!

!2016-12-21_1135.png|width=585,height=191!
fields.summary: Sort and Filter in Releases page

fields.description:
It will be great if we have feature that the newly created repository added automatically in DVCS  account in JIRA. 

Currently, we need to refresh repositories in the JIRA DVCS account, so that the new repository will be added.
fields.summary: Adding new repository should automatically added to JIRA DVCS account without refreshing the DVCS account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
If a board's filter query is changed so that it shows issues from a different project, and that new project's workflow does not contain the statuses set up in the board configuration, they will not be usable. This is a problem for any user who wants to set up a board ONCE, and copy it to use it for other projects without having to do much extra work.

h3. Suggestion Solutions:
1. When a board has statuses that do not belong to the project it is showing issues from, provide a button along the lines of "Add these statuses to the project [Project Name]" to quickly add all missing statuses to that project's workflow. The user can already do this one status at a time with the "Add Status" button, so this new button would simply automate that process.

2. When a board has statuses that do not belong to the project it is showing issues from, provide a button on each status that does not belong (And therefore has a yellow exclamation mark symbol) which lets the user quickly add that status to the project it is missing from.

3. Allow the user to assign a different workflow to a board, WITHOUT turning off the "Simplified Workflow" features. This way the user can set up ONE workflow, point all of their boards at it, and they'll all have the same statuses available, but they can also carry on adding statuses/columns simply. This will, of course, add those same statuses to all the linked boards, so a warning will need to be shown to this effect.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Software boards Columns usability when changing the filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Board Filters can end up with invalid JQL syntax when the underlying data of the query is modified or removed. e.g. a component that is referenced gets removed or renamed, an issue key that is referenced is deleted, etc etc.

 

Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your project board
 # Choose *Board* > *Configure* > *Filters*
 # Edit or Create a Filter with a valid query and Save.
 # The Board will display data as expected
 # Invalidate the query created in Step 3 *by modifying some meta data in JIRA that is referenced in the query*
 # This will error out in the issue navigator where the query is validated before execution
 # since the query was valid when it was saved; it stays set in the Board Config. 
 # When you access the Board - no Data is Displayed

h3. Expected Results

There should be an error on the Board saying the underlying query in INVALID.
h3. Actual Results

The Board displays no data without any errors or warnings.
fields.summary: Board Filters can end up with invalid JQL when underlying data used in the query are deleted or modified

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the [Velocity Chart documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER072/Velocity+Chart] is not explicit with regards to the fact that sub-task's Original Time Estimate are not used in calculating the velocity per sprint. The lack of this information can cause confusion, which can explain the creation of the following feature request and bug report:
* [JSW-15302 : Allow option for Velocity Chart to include sub-task estimates|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15302]
* [JSW-9164 : Sub-task hours estimate not reflected in planning and reports|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-9164]

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify the Velocity Chart documentation with the explicit fact that sub-task's estimates are not part of the velocity calculation, perhaps along with an explanation of the logic and implementation as well.
fields.summary: Improve Velocity Chart documentation with regards to sub-task estimates

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently when completing a Sprint that has many (Tested with 350 and 184) uncompleted issues, and choose to move the uncompleted issues to a future Sprint, the issues are first moved to *Backlog* and after about 30 seconds are moved to the selected Sprint.

In clean instances, we were able to reproduce this with 3500 issues.

This might confuse the customers that the issues are moved to Backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board and 2 sprints
# Create 3500 issues in one sprint
# Start and complete sprint (keep all issues open)
# Select option to move issues to the other sprint.

h3. Expected Results

All issues are processed and moved to the other sprint.

h3. Actual Results
Operation times out and we get this error:
!Sprint timeout.png|thumbnail! 

Only part of the issues are moved to the other sprint.

h3. Notes
We can see different number of issues causing this problem depending on the issues. Simple issues on clean instance on new projects seem to require 3500+ issues to cause this problem.

h3.Workaround
First bulk move some tickets to the other sprint and then complete it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve performance
fields.summary: Improve performance when moving issues to next Sprint contains many issues

fields.description:
h4. Summary
{{atlassian-greenhopper.log}} in JIRA 7.2.x does not log any information

h4. Step to reproduce
# Setup JIRA 7.2.x
# Check {{$JIRA_HOME/log/atlassian-greenhopper.log}}

h4. Expected Result
This log will log information of anything related to JIRA Software functionality including upgrade history, upgradetask, and error related to JIRA Software.
Example: 
{noformat}
2018-03-05 00:56:21,715 ThreadPoolAsyncTaskExecutor::Thread 13 INFO      [greenhopper.service.logging.LogSupport]

*********************************************************************************
Atlassian GreenHopper v7.2.8-DAILY20171106154814 #73360baaf8b0a790 built 2017-11-06T16:54:30.872+01:00 - plugin starting...
*********************************************************************************
{noformat}

h4. Actual Result
This log file is empty. It is reproducible for new instance as well as upgraded instance.

h4. Workaround 
* After each restart set logging _INFO_ for {{com.atlassian.greenhopper}} 
* Or add manually logger to {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}} file, example for Jira 7.2.12: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
--- atlassian-jira-software-7.2.12-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties.orig	2017-10-10 19:53:59.000000000 +0200
+++ atlassian-jira-software-7.2.12-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties	2018-03-05 00:55:07.000000000 +0100
@@ -242,6 +242,8 @@
 log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira = INFO, console, filelog, cloudAppender
 log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira = false

+log4j.logger.com.atlassian.greenhopper = INFO
+
{code}
fields.summary: atlassian-greenhopper.log in JIRA 7.2.x does not log any information

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you configured your custom field context to only certain specific issue type, and you configure the Agile Board's 'Issue Details View' to call this custom field, {{c.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess}} will be throwing error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a new JIRA KANBAN board. With the filter set to one particular project
 # Create a custom field called 'Test'
 # Set the context for the field for 'Bug' issue type only
 # Go to the Board's configuration > Issue Detail View and add this field
 # Create a new issue on the board, with Task issue type
 # On the board, click on the issue to trigger the right details issue view panel

h3. Expected Results

No error is thrown in the logs
h3. Actual Results

Below exception is thrown in the atlassian.log file:
{noformat}
/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/issue/details.json [c.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException - config should not be null!'.
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: config should not be null!
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.notNull(Assertions.java:25)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl$2.call(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl$2.call(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess.call(SafePluginPointAccess.java:187)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.getSupplierValueOrHtmlErrorMessage(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:372)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.getEditHtml(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.getEditHtml(ImmutableCustomField.java:889)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.detailview.DetailViewInlineEditableFieldFactory.getFieldHtmlBean(DetailViewInlineEditableFieldFactory.java:263)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.detailview.DetailViewInlineEditableFieldFactory.lambda$getDetailViewEditableFields$54(DetailViewInlineEditableFieldFactory.java:162)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
{noformat}
h3. Notes

This is not impacting any functionality. Just on logging

 
h3. *Workaround*

Jira Administrators can hide logging on the package by increasing logging level to ERROR.

You can achieve this by adding these lines into *log4j.properties*:
{code:java}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.ozymandias  = ERROR, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.ozymandias = false
{code}
For changes to make an effect, Jira restart is required.

The file log4j.properties is located at JIRA_INSTALL_DIR/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes (as of Jira 7.12.x)

(on) Mind, this would make the log lines disappear, yet would not address the root cause.
 The actual case had to be addressed by the plug-in vendor.
fields.summary: Configuring a board's Issue Details View to include custom fields with specific issue type contexts causes SafePluginPointAccess errors in the logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira re-index roughly 5 times slower in JIRA Software than in JIRA Data Center using PostgreSQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Case1:
# Setup a PostgreSQL instance 
# Install Jira Software 7.2.4 (non-data center install)
# Populate the instance using the [Atlassian Populator|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/atlassian-populator/dhlljlojpmdpcfjocjilidojdgfoiajn]
# Do a foreground re-index 
# Record re-index duration

Case2:
# Setup a PostgreSQL instance 
# Install a fresh Jira 7.2.4 Data Center install (without Jira Software), single node only
# Populate data using the [Atlassian Populator|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/atlassian-populator/dhlljlojpmdpcfjocjilidojdgfoiajn] (use the same data as step 2 above for consistency)
# Do a foreground re-index 
# Record re-index duration


h3. Expected Results
Re-indexing with and w/out Jira Software takes roughly the same amount of time since the same indexer threads are configured and I/O, CPU, and connectivity is the same.

h3. Actual Results
Re-indexing with Jira Software is roughly 5x slower

h3. Notes
These are base tests, but the difference can be critical in a large instance as a reindex can take up to 12 hours when it can take 2.
These results can also be consistently replicated.
This same behaviour is not present in other database flavors.


*PSQL - Non-DC - Jira Software*
{code:borderStyle=solid}2016-12-07 13:06:01,454 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 INFO admin 785x381x3 10n8scs 172.20.44.59 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All complete. Total time: 59112ms. Reindex run: 1{code}

{code:borderStyle=solid}2016-12-07 13:24:25,632 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 INFO admin 803x319x1 16xsnzm 172.20.44.59 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All complete. Total time: 57641ms. Reindex run: 1{code}


*PSQL - DC -  JIRA DC using a single node*
{code:borderStyle=solid}2016-12-07 13:29:30,656 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 INFO admin 809x57x1 w3ybep 172.20.44.59 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All complete. Total time: 13569ms. Reindex run: 2{code}

{code:borderStyle=solid}2016-12-07 13:30:04,257 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 809x157x1 w3ybep 172.20.44.59 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All complete. Total time: 11422ms. Reindex run: 3{code}


||Instance Description||Time Taken||
|PSQL - Non-DC - Jira Software|  59112ms and 57641ms |
|PSQL - DC -  JIRA DC using a single node |13569ms and 11422ms |

*Workaround:*
-None so far
fields.summary: Jira foregound re-index is roughly 5 times slower in JIRA Software when compared to JIRA Data Center using PSQL

This has an enormous value for project prospection, sales estimates, and backlog management (it is great to be able to know how long your backlog before creating and sizing stories.

We would like to have this as a system field, that we can use for EPICs, and not a custom field we create and that will generate custom formatted data, hard to manage down the road for add-ons, or JIRA upgrades. 

More info here:

[https://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/estimating-with-tee-shirt-sizes] 

https://www.sitepoint.com/3-powerful-estimation-techniques-for-agile-teams/

h3. Summary

When browsing to '*All Boards*' it's possible the 1min Ajax timeout in JIRA kicks in, preventing the board list from loading. This will result in a timeout as per the attached screenshot.
Problem is caused by slow response to call {{rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData}} from JIRA, which does resolving project list for each loaded board.

h3. Environment
Reproduced with the following instance size:
* Projects: 1k+
* Boards: 1k+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use a large instance, such as above.
# Access the *All boards* page

h3. Expected Results
* Viewing Rapid Boards responds in a reasonable time frame (less then 1 minute)

h3. Actual Results
The ajax timeout kicks in and the page times out whilst waiting for {{rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData}} to return results, or the board can take > 1 minute to load.
 !View All Boards.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Regression was introduced in JIRA Software 7.1.0
* {{RapidViewProjectHelper.getRapidViewProjectList}} is called for every RapidView query visible on "All boards" page. Underneath this method requests the list of all available projects: getAllProjectsForAction goes through every single project and filters them out by given permissions.

h3. Verification
Generate a thread-dump and following will be present in the stacktrace for long-running threads:
* There should be slow running thread related /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData call
* Class {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel}} will be present in the stacktrace for long-running threads together with {{com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.getAllProjectsForAction}}:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-80-exec-125" #126716 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0000000055262000 nid=0x1eac runnable [0x0000000079d6a000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3937)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4739)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.CachingProjectRoleAndActorStore.getProjectRoleActors(CachingProjectRoleAndActorStore.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.DefaultProjectRoleManager.getProjectRoleActors(DefaultProjectRoleManager.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.jira.notification.type.ProjectRoleSecurityAndNotificationType.getProjectRoleActors(ProjectRoleSecurityAndNotificationType.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.jira.notification.type.ProjectRoleSecurityAndNotificationType.hasPermission(ProjectRoleSecurityAndNotificationType.java:141)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.ProjectAction.hasPermission(ProjectAction.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.checkActionPermission(DefaultProjectService.java:947)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService$1.apply(DefaultProjectService.java:765)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService$1.apply(DefaultProjectService.java:762)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$7.computeNext(Iterators.java:652)
	at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.tryToComputeNext(AbstractIterator.java:143)
	at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.hasNext(AbstractIterator.java:138)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.addAll(Iterators.java:361)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:160)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.getAllProjectsForAction(DefaultProjectService.java:768)
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewProjectHelper.getRapidViewProjectList(RapidViewProjectHelper.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewFilterHelper.buildSavedFilterEntry(RapidViewFilterHelper.java:281)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListEntry(RapidViewListHelper.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListModel(RapidViewListHelper.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListAndConfigModel(RapidViewListHelper.java:105)
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel(RapidViewListResource.java:74)
...
{code}

h3. Workaround
You can increase the timeout as mentioned in [How to change the default AJAX timeout in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+AJAX+timeout+in+JIRA].
fields.summary: JIRA Software Viewing All Boards can timeout due to resolving project list for each loaded board

the use case would be to list all bugs that were raised (but not necessarily fixed) during a certain sprint. the only way to do this now would be to know the start and end date of the specific sprint and then search for issues created during that time period. fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changing the workflow closed status linking from done(yellow) to closed(green) ends up with corrupt reports.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# - create board with sample data (or manually create project, issues with estimates and versions, and add a couple of sprints)
# look at the reports for version 2.0
eg. !release-burndown-before.png|thumbnail!
# change the workflow, for example to classic, and associate Done with Closed
!release-burndown-issue-history-after.png|thumbnail!
# look at the reports for version 2.0
!release-burndown-after.png|thumbnail!
# remap statuses into proper column in board configuration
# look at the reports for version 2.0
eg. !release-burndown-after-rm-old-statuses.png|thumbnail!
# change/edit the workflow so that it has old statuses and new statuses
# remap statuses into proper column in board configuration
eg. !release-burndown-after-wf-2-and-remap-cols.png|thumbnail!
# look at the reports for version 2.0
eg. !release-burndown-after-wf-and-remap-cols.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
The Release Burndown chart should not change.

h3. Actual Results
After workflow change the release burndown report has also changed. Even proper remapping of statuses to columns in the board configuration does not help.
The outcome of the last step is similar to the original one, not the same though. 
 


h3.Workaround
Change the workflow again and remap Done -> Closed. The report is not the same as the original one but it is similar to the original one.
fields.summary: Agile reports corrupted after workflow update

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Starting in JIRA 7.2.0, the issue detail view in boards became editable, per [JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes].

When editing a Story points field, such as Estimate, changes are not confirmed unless the user explicitly uses the Enter key on the keyboard, or clicks the checkmark button. Other fields in JIRA, including other editable fields in the Board Issue Detail View and in the regular JIRA Issue view, confirm changes once the user clicks away from the field, changing focus. 

When the user does edit the Estimate field and clicks any whitespace on the page, the field remains in edit mode. This does not happen with the other editable fields, such as Labels.
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Change the behavior of the Estimate field so that changing focus away from the field automatically confirms the change. This is to keep it in line with already existing behavior for other fields.

h3. Why this is important
 
While this behavior remains inconsistent, users may expect their changes to be committed once focus is changed, and may inadvertently switch to a different issue thinking the change was saved. 

h3. Workaround 

Explicitly confirm the change using Enter key or by clicking the check button before switching to any other issues or screens.
fields.summary: Make editing Story Points/Estimate in Board Issue Detail View more consistent with the rest of JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-15282].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Starting in JIRA 7.2.0, the issue detail view in boards became editable, per [JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.2.x+release+notes].

When story points are being edited in this issue detail view, a info bubble with the text "Story Points" appears, which ends up appearing right on top of where the confirm check button is. While the bubble is present, you cannot click on the confirm check button (also where it overlaps with the cancel check button, the same thing will happen there). Moving the mouse will cause this to rapidly flash in and out of the screen, interfering with the user's ability to click either of these boxes.

Better visualized:
 [^Story_Points.mp4] 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.0 - JIRA 7.2.3
Firefox 49.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Ensure that Story Points are visible in the screens for the project(s) the board is configured with to ensure that the field will be editable
2. Click the Estimate to try to edit the value inside
3. Note the Story Points bubble popping up

h3. Expected Results

The bubble should not be showing when trying to click the button. The other fields that are editable on this screen all show a different bubble, "Press Alt+s to submit this form", and the bubble doesn't overlap with the buttons.

h3. Actual Results

The bubble pops up, interfering with the buttons.
 
h3. Notes

The severity of this behavior appears to be environment specific. I found that my success rate for clicking the button and avoiding the bubble was very high, but other environments may find that the bubble persists longer, appears more frequency, etc..

h3.Workaround

Confirm your edit using the Enter key on your keyboard instead of clicking the button.
fields.summary: Story Points info bubble on JIRA Software interferes with confirmation check button in board's issue detail view

fields.description:
When subtasks are configured for time tracking and the parent is not configured for time tracking, if you add the parent issue to a sprint without an original estimate added you get an error 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Create a parent issue without time tracking fields present
2.  Create a subtask and do not input time into the Original Estimate field
3.  Add the parent issue to a Sprint

When you follow these steps you get an error that states the scope will change.

Suggestion:

The warning should be more verbose as to what the issue is so it can be corrected or the admin should be allowed to edit the error message to relieve end user confusion.
fields.summary: Improve scope change warning when parent issue not configured for time-tracking

fields.description:
As a JIRA administrator,

I'd like to be able to disable the creation of new statuses by standard users through the Simplified Workflow's 'Add Status' button

so that I can:
 * avoid the creation of effectively duplicated status names like "To Do" & "TODO", or Testing & Test & Tested & In Test & Integration Test
 * make easier multi-project JQL queries to retrieve meaningful info based on statuses
 * make more maintainable the order in which statuses are displayed in gadgets and JQL ORDER BY clause.
 * avoid the creation of statuses for trying to store info when it would be better to use anything else instead (labels, the resolution field, a custom field...)
fields.summary: Simplified Workflow: add option to disable the creation of new statuses
